Gordon Crowbar Bizarre Adventure
The game that started it all. An fps game with strong narrative and astounding gameplay for it's time (1998). Everyone with a PC should try this at once. 

Pros : 
- Fun gunplay
- Level design
- Bhopping
- Story
- Goldsrc
- Details
- Cheap. Good for your wallet. All hail Gaben.

Cons :
- Outdated graphics? (i know this is natural because of the time release, but still important tho, for newer gaming generation).

[h1]Fantastic[/h1]
There's nothing about this game I can say that hasn't already been. [i]Half-Life[/i] is fantastic and an absolute must-play, even for those who aren't usually a fan of the genre. It's an all-time favourite of mine, and I cannot recommend it enough.

Про эту игру уже было много сказано, поэтому если никогда не играли, то вы должны хотя бы просто запустить её. Также рекомендую к ознакомлению очень качественный ремейк Black Mesa

Несмотря на то, что лично для меня первая часть HL уступает второй как в плане сюжета, так и геймплея, все же нельзя не отметить, что для 1998 года эта игра - настоящий прорыв. Как по графике, так и по подаче сюжета, в котором абсолютно нет катсцен. А еще она довольно хардкорна даже на легком уровне сложности, что для современного игрока достаточно непривычно :)

This game is a masterpiece. The story is so creative, and I'm honestly super impressed that such an amazing game was made in '98. If you like First-person Shooter games and puzzle games, than I would highly recommend playing this game. However, if you can't stand old graphics, than I would recommend getting the remastered version of this game called "Black Mesa" (not sponsored).

After beating the game, I would personally recommend it. There were some things that bugged me, like I didn't know where to go or what to do a lot of the time, but I cannot tell if that was just me being dumb or the game being cryptic. But this is my first FPS, so I dunno. However, this game is declared a masterpiece and an icon of gaming, so if you're in to FPS's, then go for it and have fun. There's this gun you get called the Hivehand which doesn't run out of ammo. I say use that as often as you can to save ammo for very tough situations.
6/10 - controls and combat were bummy, but the alien and level designs were pretty cool. It was also a revolutionary game for its time.
Literally one of the greatest games ever made and only $1 on sale

A great game. There are a few moments which I think could have been done a lot better, such as the ending level, the first couple of levels, and a few other bits here and there, but overall it is a great game. Definitely worth the money. Play it now if you haven't already. Great story, mostly great weapons, simple but fun gameplay and a highly immersive presentation (no cutscenes), and a great story as well.

You have to let this person do it. Valve Software is a startup, a relatively unknown company with no trail and no real business to make such a powerful game. But it's powerful and the best single player shooter I've ever played. For some people -- especially those who haven't played the game -- it's hard to pinpoint exactly what everyone's talking about. There's nothing special about the engine - it's a heavily modified version of Quake by Id Software. Its genre, first-person shooters, almost got beaten to death. Its design couldn't be simpler: grab a gun, run, shoot, jump; there's no tedious cutscenes or dislocated RPG elements here. The weapons aren't spectacular either, just your usual assortment of realistic modern guns and some alien gadgets with some new twists. The creatures are fairly standard in a way, and many of the levels have been done before. Personally, no particular element of Half-Life stands out more than others, and nothing makes or breaks the game.
